static uint maxBodySize = MAX_MSG_BODY_SIZE_DEFAULT
 Actual maximum Message body size.

Detailed Description

Message data structure.

This structure abstracts and encapsulates the buffers used by the framework. The buffer management policies used by the framework deals with messages. Also, this class describes the format of the data exchanged over-the-wire between the server and its clients; this format includes a counter giving the size of the payload data, starting and ending flags, and other control fields that can be used by the applications. Thread.

Definition at line 28 of file MessageImpl.h.

TC2API int message_compareToMessage ( cchar *  srcAddr1,
const Message *  srcMsg2,
ushort  msgOffset,
ushort  size 
)

Compares data from an application buffer with the message body.

Usage: 

    int result = message_compareToMessage(buffer, message, offset, size);
Parameters:
[in] srcAddr1 : first operand of comparison
[in] srcMsg2 : second operand of comparison
[in] msgOffset : offset into destination Message buffer where to begin compare
[in] size : number of bytes to compare
Returns:
like memcmp: -1, 0, 1
Precondition:
srcMsg2 must have valid size (see message_setSize)

Definition at line 207 of file Message.c.

00209 {
00210    char* srcAddr2;
00211    log_func(message_compareToMessage);
00212 
00213    if (!srcAddr1)
00214    {
00215       log_ferror("source address 1 is null");
00216       return -1; // tries to be consistent
00217    }
00218 
00219    if (!srcMsg2)
00220    {
00221       log_ferror("source Message 2 is null");
00222       return 1;  // tries to be consistent 
00223    }
00224 
00225    if (msgOffset >= srcMsg2->size)
00226    {
00227       log_ferror("invalid message 2 offset: %d", msgOffset);
00228       return 1;  // tries (a little harder) to be consistent 
00229    }
00230 
00231    if (size > (srcMsg2->size - msgOffset))
00232    {
00233       log_ferror("invalid compare size: %d", size);
00234       return 1; // tries (a little more harder) to be consistent  
00235    }
00236 
00237    srcAddr2 = (char*)(srcMsg2->body) + msgOffset;
00238    return memcmp(srcAddr1, srcAddr2, size);
00239 }
